pr_title: refactor: Watcher.onClose has dedicated WatcherException as parameter.

timeline.message: refactor: Watcher.onClose has dedicated WatcherException as parameter.

Suggested change
return getCause() instanceof KubernetesClientException ?

timeline.author: metacosm

timeline.body: Why did you make this method final?
timeline.bodyText: Why did you make this method final?
timeline.bodyHTML: Why did you make this method final?
timeline.author: metacosm

replies.bodyText:
It's a helper method only used by the *Manager implementations. I'm still working on that, but this method is not supposed to be called from the outside neither improved.
As I said, I'm trying to move as much as possible from the vaious *Managers to this class, but it's a WIP.
replies.author: manusa

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
assertEquals(410, cause.asClientException().getCode());
assertTrue(410, cause.isHttpGone());
timeline.author: metacosm

timeline.body: I don't understand why it's `Http` but `URL`… 🤦 😀
timeline.bodyText: I don't understand why it's Http but URL… 🤦 😀
timeline.bodyHTML: I don't understand why it's Http but URL… 🤦 😀
timeline.author: metacosm

timeline.body: I don't think that this addresses the issue because very often what triggers the call to `close` here is an exception, which is still not propagated in that case.
timeline.bodyText: I don't think that this addresses the issue because very often what triggers the call to close here is an exception, which is still not propagated in that case.
timeline.bodyHTML: I don't think that this addresses the issue because very often what triggers the call to close here is an exception, which is still not propagated in that case.
timeline.author: metacosm

replies.bodyText:
I really don't see how an Exception will trigger this close since this method will most probably be called by try-with-resources Closable.
In the event of an Exception triggering this close, the client would also be aware of the Exception via the catch block.
Do you have any code which shows this "because very often what triggers the call to close here is an exception" so I can understand better?
replies.author: manusa
